website_summaries.verdict: This salt grinder offers a modern and unique look that'll look great on your dining room table.
pros: Top is easy to unscrew for filling
Adjustable salt grain size function works well
Also comes in a set with a pepper mill
cons: Tends to leave a trail of grindings after use

customer_reviews.title: Two Years and Still Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Cole & Mason Derwent Pepper Grinder in February of 2015 and I'm just getting around to reviewing it. It has stood the test of time. I've had a dozen pepper mills over the decades (e.g. Peugeot, Unicorn, Kyocera, Oxo, etc.), and this Cole & Mason pepper grinder has always been my favorite for its consistent fine grind and durability. Maybe I've just been lucky since some other reviewers seem to have had problems. I'd buy this pepper grinder again in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: SankaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Leaks pepper every time I set it down, OLD model with painted dots.  FAR too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: This is the OLD model that has the grind-selection dots painted on, rather than etched in. It does "leak" ground pepper - before I even turned it the first time. It leaks every single time I sit it down and on every grind setting. For this price I'd return it to a store, for half the price I'd have given it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: SeaCorey

customer_reviews.title: Great value, worth spending a bit more for a good grinder
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! Two years ago I was given the pepper mill as a gift, love it so much, decided to get the salt grinder to match. Big enough to hold a lot, but not too heavy, and I can use it while wearing oven mitts. Keep in mind - when going from coarse grind to fine, you need to twist a few times to clear out the big chunks remaining in the works, before you get a fine grind. Fine is really fine, coarse is really chunky. Easy to keep clean, easy to reload, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JuBe

customer_reviews.title: ... and usually only do so if something is really good. This pepper grinder
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews and usually only do so if something is really good. This pepper grinder, on the other hand, is another story. You can turn it all day and only get a minimal amount of cracked pepper to come out. I have the salt grinder as I ordered them together and that works fine. Given the other positive reviews, I am quite disappointed. I must have gotten a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Niel Sin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I was moving to a new house and I thought I would get more classier and better pepper and salt grinders for my kitchen (previously used OXO, which still work flawlessly till today after 4 years of use). I was disappointed. Both of them loosened up quite a bit and each time same turn produces different amount of the product, it feels like mechanism inside is supper cheap or something....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart, overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: I own the salt grinder and it works fine. But the pepper mill is a joke. Very hard to turn to adjust grind, and all the grinds look the same. After owning two weeks I went to refill and top came apart in my hand. On inspection it is so cheaply made I can't believe the price I paid. It replaced one I bought for $5 years ago which worked great. So back to Wal Mart!
customer_reviews.author: Rotherhamgirl

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Contacted the company 3 months ago for replacement. 2 conversations and photos with proof of purchase sent then, nothing. No response. This was not a cheap grinder. Customer service is spotty at best. very disappointed and out the price of a faulty pepper mill.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic clear piece.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed it was not glass. The top and bottom side parts are a metal. No instructions on how to put in the peppercorns, so have not figured that one out yet. As you can see in picture it doesn't come full with peppercorns. Bought a salt grinder at Home Goods for $5 and am more pleased with it than this expensive almost $50 pepper grinder. (See salt grinder in last picture. It came completely full with salt! It's glass and comes with a cover to hold unused ground particles. )
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Most
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a few pepper grinders over the years from retailers in my area paying $20 - $30 a piece. They were impossible to adjust and I ultimately threw them out. I have had no problems with this product. It is easy to adjust and works great. The only drawbacks are that the cap is a little hard to remove to refill and the grind on the fine setting may not be fine enough for some people. I just bought another as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Reagal

customer_reviews.title: I agree with Cook's Country TV show recommendation .
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder about 6 months ago. I have liked it so much that I bought another one a month ago with enough confidence to gift it as a Christmas gift to a friend who is an enthusiastic chef . It has been 1 month. She loves it too! It holds lots of pepper, easy to refill, and the grinder coarseness is easily adjustable. I chose this grinder because it was the highest rated on the PBS cooking show "Cooks Country" . Now, is my favourite too! BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: BrookhavenGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the original grinder because something was wrong with the mechanism that adjusts the grinds. The company responded quickly. They replaced the grinder immediately and I returned the mal-functioning one at no cost. The replacement works really easily and well. I had no idea a grinder could be this good, as I have been struggling with a poor one for years. The only reason I didn't give it a five is that it is too soon to know how it will hold up. However it seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Von Fischer

customer_reviews.title: If you want fine grind, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: The fine grind is not fine grind. There are big chunks of pepper in fine grind, that should not be. Americas Test Kitchen demonstrated it years ago and and fine grind was FINE GRIND. Maybe I ordered wrong one. They tested the Cole & Mason Derwent Precision Pepper Mill Batch 140228 or higher. Could not rate "Easy to clean" as I haven't cleaned it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Koob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grinder
customer_reviews.text: As a chef I've purchase many grinders. For the most part they are garbage. This one really works! It will put large flakes of pepper on your food and lots of it at one time. The last grinder I bought wouldn't even grind pepper seeds. Some of the others took a long time to get the amount you needed and weren't course. If you want a great pepper mill then this is the one. Bite the bullet and buy it. you will be glad you did. UPDATE: The salt one also works very well. Gives you very course salt which most don't. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Billieg

customer_reviews.title: Filling is the only downside
customer_reviews.text: While I love the performance of these S&P grinders I find them much messier to fill then our previous Cole and Mason set which these replaced. The previous ones disintegrated around the bottom edges where plastic met the metal. These require pulling the top away from the base. When I pull, the two pieces fly apart spilling the contents a bit. Other than that, they're marvelous. I still highly recommend. Just be careful filling.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love these grinders. I have the pepper, a salt for sea salt, and another salt for pink salt, and they work great. Only reason for 4 stars vs. 5 stars is because the writing wears off over time, so you can't see the level of grind. But there are only 3 positions, so it's not hard to figure out. I wish they would have laser etched them though instead of the screen print.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend at all!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my prior pepper mill was broken. I just tried to refill it. It is very difficult to open as you have to unscrew from the bottom, remove the grinder and refill. So far, I have been unable to get the parts reassembled. The grinder will not push down far enough to allow the screw to grab the threads inside and reattach. A process that should only take a few minutes has so far taken me almost an hour. Totally unacceptable. Would not recommend this product since there are so many other to choose from that are so much easier to refill. I will order a different version.
customer_reviews.author: proudtexan

customer_reviews.title: THIS ITEM IS MISREPRESENTED IN THE AD
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy anything from Cole and Mason again. They have no respect for their own products. They shipped this overpriced salt mill in a flimsy bubble wrap bag so the item fell apart and the salt spilled. It is not copper but copper colored plastic. It is impossible to change grinder settings.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Katz

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: We have been looking for a pepper grinder for years and haven't been happy with those that we bought. We purchased this grinder from Amazon thinking what the heck. Well, we couldn't be more pleased with our new grinder, it has several courses from fine to king of big, its easy to refill, looks good on our dining table and gives each of the size of pepper we want. Definitely a keeper and easy to clean too. Barb
customer_reviews.author: Terry Koenig

customer_reviews.title: What a difference over the pepper mill that that you get for $5 and throw away when you run out
customer_reviews.text: It is a beautiful product, that is well designed, easy to adjust and just works great. I usually buy a pepper grinder at the big box store that has pepper in it. When it was empty I would throw it away and get another one that was not good at getting the exact grind I wanted. I like a course grind for a steak and a fine grind for my fried eggs. I get that and everything in between. I know this will last a long time and also looks beautiful on the table when I have guests over for dinner. It is well worth the money and it comes with very good pepper upon purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Terrible warranty service
customer_reviews.text: Terrible warranty service-The product is good but after a couple of years the grinder mechanism fell apart and they tout a lifetime warranty so I went through the process filled the form took a picture uploaded sent a picture of the broken part to the company and then they send me an email back that I need to ship the broken pepper grinder back to them -shipping myself and go through all the inconvenience and cost of shipping-so buy this use it -when it breaks get ready to buy another one but don’t depend on this crappy warranty because it’s a farce
customer_reviews.author: bsk

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: What I received was not as pictured. It came unpackaged with no tags or instructions. The picture shows the bottom in stainless steel with the manufacturers name on the bar, there was none on the one received. What I received was made of cheap plastic. The inside where it grinds is all plastic. Again does not match the description pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A

customer_reviews.title: A splurge I’d do again
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit this was a splurge that I thought about and researched an excessively long time. After browsing forever, couldn’t get this one out of my head. Really enjoying it and glad I took the plunge. It’s attractive in a way that would suit any kitchen, easy to use and refill. Pretty confident it’ll last a long time, which was one of my goals. The only problem is that I’m going through lots of peppercorns now, because we’re all using it so much. We never went through pre-ground pepper like this. I might need another one for green or pink peppercorns now too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cole & Mason grinders
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I’ve bought a slug of grinders some good and some really sucked , I was really hesitant about shelling out $90 + for a set of salt and pepper mills but I did anyway. I’ve only had them for a short time but they grind much better than anything I’ve tried before,...we’ll see how they hold up over the long run but they seem like a good purchase ,...so far
customer_reviews.author: G'MAN

customer_reviews.title: Decent pepper mill
customer_reviews.text: I like this mill, and have use it constantly for about 18 months now. The grinder mechanism has been really reliable so far, and the mill feels good in the hand. I have the stainless steel version, and I've found the cap is a pain to remove to fill up the grinder, and the metal cover has separated from the plastic piece underneath a few times now. Fortunately, I don't have to fill it up all the time, and if I use a butter knife between the glass and plastic cap, the caps pops right off without separating. Other than that one complaint, I like this grinder quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time before I bought this pepper grinder, because it was relatively expensive. Now that I finally have it, I wish I had bought it years ago. The grinding is adjustable so that I get the grade of pepper that I want. The grind is uniform, so that you don't get a large piece of pepper that ends up sticking in your throat which takes your breath away. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great! This works
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Finally, a pepper grinder that actually works. Grind coarseness works, and plenty comes out. I've been through at least 3 different types of grinders and this one works really, really well. Amazing that in this day and age it is so hard to find a pepper grinder that actually works! Get this, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Ribaudo

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product. Pepper arrived full of peppercorns which was a cool surprise. I ordered the salt mill a few days later and came 1/4 full .. ?? That’s fine... you will definitely want to buy a tiny mat or stand for these as they definitely leak ground pepper and salt from picking them up and putting down. No cover for the bottom so it just gets little particles everywhere. Mill works good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda P.

customer_reviews.title: Came with virtually no salt, and the largest setting is too small for pretzels
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to use this for putting salt onto pretzels prior to baking. Although the settings show the correct target size on the side, setting it to that size still gives relatively small crystals of salt not appropriate for pretzels. I will have to look elsewhere. I also gave this a mediocre rating because it is flimsy and will not last very long. These are made in china despite the name.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: COLE & MASON Derwent Salt Grinder - Stainless Steel Mill Includes Gourmet Precision Mechanism
customer_reviews.text: COLE & MASON Derwent Salt Grinder - Stainless Steel Mill Includes Gourmet Precision Mechanism I now have both the Salt and Pepper Mill. They are great. The mills are adjustable for very fine to extra coarse. I like coarse ground pepper and my wife likes fine ground. We can satisfy our needs with one Pepper mill sitting on the table now. I have over six (6) different pepper/coffee mills made from brass, plastic and wood, they all grind pepper but this one works better for me. Adjustments: six (6) Preset grinds, Coarse to Fine for Pepper and three (3) Preset Grinds, Coarse to fine for Salt
customer_reviews.author: MEP

customer_reviews.title: The perfect pepper grinder finally!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased so many pepper grinders to find out that they don't work for one reason or another. They don't grind the peppercorns correctly or they get clogged up and then you have to use muscles to get them to work right, all frustrating. Then I see this one being used on a test kitchen show and liked what they said. I LOVE IT!!! The settings are accurate, it grinds to perfection on each setting, it turns with ease, very nice top fill and so far no clogging up and having to wrestle with using it. This is the perfect pepper grinder and my next purchase will be the salt grinder!!! You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quits working after 3 years and warranty process is very cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after 3 years. Disassemble the mill, cleaned everything and it still will not grind pepper. Warranty process requires taking pictures of the mill and your receipt and uploading to their website.... after taking the time to resize the pictures to fit the site limitations, (2mb). Web site does not accept a pdf of the receipt, only picture files. What a pain in the backside....and not a very user friendly process especially for what I consider to be an expensive pepper mill.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Venable

customer_reviews.title: unusual use: feeding my fish with it
customer_reviews.text: works great to finely grind my ember tetra's food. I got the ember tetra's a little over a week ago, these are small fish that were unable or refusing to eat 'micro pellets' or hand crushed flake food. we use one of these mills for our pepper and noted the fine setting produces a uniform grind, so I thought I'd buy another one and try it on my ember's fish food. after a week of using a mix of 'micro pellets' and flake in the grinder my ember tretra's seem to like it and are doing great. next I'm going to try other food for them as I don't have to be concerned with food size.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Best Pepper Grinder of All Time
customer_reviews.text: If you want a good pepper grinder just buy this one. Turning the bottom to select the size works great. This thing hardly gives any resistance when turning it and is always nice and smooth. No more messing around turning random knobs on other pepper grinders only to have pieces fall off... I should have bought this one years ago. Instead I purchased a bunch of mediocre ones that kept getting thrown away before I found this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Conklin

customer_reviews.title: It's a solid "ok".
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a new pepper mill for quite some time. This one has really great variety of ground thickness which is nice. Other than that it is just ok, I wanted to like it more than I do. It is sorta hard to grind and not much comes out with every crank. You have to really work at it to get any measurable amounts. It works, looks nice and had some good options but did not end my search for the best pepper mill. It's a solid "ok".
customer_reviews.author: jacat651

customer_reviews.title: so far a great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, great action, 3 degrees of fineness. To refill, the very tightly fitted top cap must be pulled off. It's a serious friction fit. I'm 6', 210 lbs and strong and I had trouble pulling it off. Be forewarned, don't do what I did which was to open it when there was still about a quarter cup of Himalayan pink salt crystals inside...when I finally got the lid to pop off, all those remaining crystals sprayed all over the kitchen floor. Wait until it's empty! Other than that, I am buying their pepper mill next.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Gosline

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Grind Quality and Volume!
customer_reviews.text: Finally!!!! Not just another overpriced pepper grinder! Grind quality across the full adjustment range from course to fine is perfect! Grind uniformity at all levels, course to fine, is perfect and predictable every time! Volume even at finest setting is very high saving a lot of wasted time and effort required by all most all other grinders I've owned. (I've owned at least 30 other grinders) Cheaper would be better of course but this is the best hand driven pepper grinder I've found to date. Congrats to Cole & Mason!
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN W.

customer_reviews.title: Consistent Grin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder on the recommendation of America's Test Kitchen. It is pricey but worth every dime. The grind is consistent no matter what setting the uses chooses. I did mark it a star due to easy to use. It is once you figure it out but the print of the instructions was too small to easily read it. I plan on purchasing another grinder for my other pepper corn variety. I will also purchase for future gifts. The color selection is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C

customer_reviews.title: Fine-to-coarse grinds - and easy to refill
customer_reviews.text: This is a high-quality mill that easily adjusts from a very fine grind to a coarse, almost cracked-pepper option. Easy to fill - you just pull straight up on the top cap to take it off. It took me a while to understand how to open this up for refilling. I think the instructions don't tell you and I only found out via a YouTube video. I've had this for several months and it has performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jrsygrl

customer_reviews.title: The grinder I have been looking for.
customer_reviews.text: SO worth the money! I had been looking for a good pepper grinder for months. I had several others that did not do the job. They either were huge chinks of pepper or you would be there grinding, grinding, grinding forever. I love the grind size dial. So easy to adjust & it has a nice size range. The construction is good and sturdy. I feel like it will last a long time. I am not a huge fan of acrylic but I like that I can see the peppercorns in the chamber so I guess I can't complain. I hope that it stays clear.
customer_reviews.author: MaryO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pepper Mill
customer_reviews.text: This looks great and works great. I was able to grab these when they were on sale. Both the salt and pepper mill only costed $40 after CA tax. You get six really awesome coarseness settings that's easily adjustable. I didn't care much for the salt coarseness, but wanted to grab a set so they are nice and matching. I think at $40 a piece, it's too expensive so if you bump into a deal like I did, it's definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Vuong Ly

customer_reviews.title: Best Pepper Mill!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pepper mill!! America's Test Kitchen ranks this as the best in their tests! Offers several different grind sizes and grinds them out consistently. Easy to fill. Clear body so you know when it's time to refill before you run out.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Kelso

customer_reviews.title: I. Love. This. Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this pepper grinder. I've only had it a month, but it is everything I have ever wanted in a pepper grinder. Full transparency - I always check with America's Test Kitchen when I'm going to purchase ANYTHING that belongs in a kitchen or relative to cooking, baking, etc. and this is the one that won several of their tests. It is, in my mind, a perfect intersection of form, function and value. The price can initially be offputting, but considering I've purchased any number of pepper grinders for $10-20 that I've immediately been dissatisfied with, this is a bargain. I plan to buy several more for the different kinds of pepper I use.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: The best pepper Mill ever ?
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction stainless steel grinder not plastic. Easy to fill just pop the top off, several grind settings. Caution, this puts out lots of pepper per twist. Have been using it for several months now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: William A Lehne JR

customer_reviews.title: This pepper mill is great (if you buy it on sale)
customer_reviews.text: This pepper mill has exceeded my expectations. It has multiple settings for granularity (and they actually work). It is very smooth and effortless to grind and it was a definite upgrade over grocery store plastic pepper bottles with built in grinders. However, I would not pay the retail $50 for this. I managed to snag this for $20 and as much as I think this product is great, I would not pay a penny more for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two of these for 2 residences, one in stainless, one in copper. I love fresh cracked pepper and the stainless grinder does a great job. Easy to grind and many adjustable options for coarseness. Works like a charm. I also purchase the one in copper and unfortunately I don’t have the same review. This one requires a lot more grinding to yield the same amount of pepper. Not sure if there is anything I can do on my end to adjust it. I’m only giving 4 ⭐️ because of the copper version.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Hard to turn
customer_reviews.text: We have a few of these in my family, but this one is very hard to use. It doesn’t turn easily and super hard to adjut the grind. We have three of the stainless steel ones that do work. I’m not being allowed to tell all of the details about this product.
customer_reviews.author: crab46

customer_reviews.title: Cole & Mason H59401G Derwent Pepper Mill, Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by America's Test Kitchen. This is the pepper grinder to have -consistent grinds, always perfect no matter what you dial. No more little knob on the top to try and figure out what the grind will be- with this, you know and it is so consistent with it's grind size. I highly recommend this - my whole family agrees that it is just the best!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It works really well. What more can I say?
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A pepper grinder I like. I purchased this because of a review on America's Test Kitchen. It works!!! It is easy to adjust the grind level. I have been warned the marks can wear off, but I do not see that as a problem. I don't really look at the marks anymore. I like that I can see how many peppercorns are left. It is easy for me to handle. The grind is consistent. I have a pepper mill graveyard for all the mills I have purchased that did not work. This is finally one I like.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Just like described.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pepper mill for five days, but I can tell you it is the best one so far I've purchased. I paid the price because of the over 1000 reviews and 4+ star rating. I hope and expect this pepper mill to last for years not months. I will buy the salt grinder as soon as my inexpensive one gives out, which will probably be anytime. So far, I haven't noticed pepper on my counter, but my countertop's multi-color would hide it well, so I'm not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ... and pricey
customer_reviews.text: After years of using my relatively inexpensive battery operated salt and pepper grinders I bought this salt grinder -- as a gift from my mom. (Haven't been able to bring myself to purchase the matching pepper grinder yet.) One mention: unlike a battery operated grinder, this one requires using two hands. No "one button grinding" here.
customer_reviews.author: ddoth

customer_reviews.title: Home Chef Approved!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We used pepper a lot when we cook. We buy good peppercorns. We like a mil that adjusts for a variety if grinds. Our last mill broke despite being expensive, fancy and ceramic grind mechanism. The body split making the grind pressure unpredictable. So without much research or shopping I ordered this mill to fill the gap while I find a suitable replacement tool. Boom! Done!! This grinder has filled the void. The grind adjustment range is excellent. The volume it emits is time saving. The clear body lets you know when to refill. The heft and durability seem like a much more expensive device. We got the gunmetal which looks unique. Don’t hesitate to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Umstead

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but grain sizing doesn’t work properly for me
customer_reviews.text: While I absolutely love the look of these salt and pepper grinders, I find it difficult to change the size of the grain. And when I hold them at the base when using, the placement of the grain size mechanism doesn’t always stay in place. I purchased these because of the variety in the size of grain one could use for various cooking tasks. I’m disappointed in their ease of changing the size and keeping it set until changed.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hardin

customer_reviews.title: nice pepper grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder produces a goodly amount of pepper at a twist. The sound or feel is different from my other grinders. This seems like it mushes the pepper. My other mills crack the pepper like it was super dry and crumbly. This one grinds the peppercorns as if they were moist. I like the feel of it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I love grinding fresh pepper on my food. We've gone thru several grinders as the blades wear out far too quickly in my opinion. This grinder has held up longer than the others I've tried. And, most importantly for me, it large grind setting still is going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Healthnut

customer_reviews.title: The daily grind never ground so good
customer_reviews.text: I've only owned this grinder for a few days now and am absolutely delighted by the various elements. The grinding motion is smooth and super easy to operate and the contents come out just as expected: Uniformly beautiful. I didn't have any issues with my old grinder -- until now. This new one really takes the cake and is worth the hype and price tag. It also seems to be super durable for when it inevitably gets tipped over or dropped. It's also super-easy to open for refilling -- just pull off the top! Loving this product.
customer_reviews.author: p barker

customer_reviews.title: Love this pepper grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pepper grinder along with the salt grinder to replace the set that I had on my dinning table that had worn out. However, they work so well that I use them for cooking as well. The ease of changing the grind size makes them very versatile. If my table and the kitchen were further apart, I'd buy two sets.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah  J Murmylo

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the Pepper Grinder I've long looked for - won't need another for a long time!
customer_reviews.text: Works excellently, just as America's Test Kitchen Cook's Country rated it as the best. Very sturdy, does not leak excessive grinds on the counter. Each grind setting grinds exactly the coarseness desired. Easy to fill. Very attractive. The one I got only has painted dots on it, not etched coursness indicators as Cook's County recommended, which Cole & Mason added to later models. (Painted dots could rub off over time.) As described, you get a lot of grind with easy much less effort,. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: KC Royals Fan from Independence, MO

customer_reviews.title: Leaves salt ring after every grind and broke after refilling twice
customer_reviews.text: Was really hopeful for this product to work. It looks good aesthetically, and the prominent materials seem like they are of high quality. However, the grinder leaves a ring of salt dust residue after every grind when placing on surfaces such as a counter, etc., which is annoying. Also, ours broke after refilling it twice. The mechanism that screws and unscrews at the bottom appears to have stripped. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MAH

customer_reviews.title: Grind is too coarse
customer_reviews.text: The finest setting of this grinder is over double butcher's grind, it is too coarse. The course grind allows the peppercorns to fall through virtually untouched. The salt grinder with only 3 settings is acceptable. These are not worth the money. Also, both leave residue where they're stored, keep them on a tray.
customer_reviews.author: William Castellini

customer_reviews.title: Ability to change grind with presets.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a grinder for my Kampot pepper corns that had adjustable preset grinds that are easily returnable to depending on your current needs. My last grinder was adjustable but would not hold a grind level, constantly changing with use. And would require checking the grind prior to each use again depending on your current need.
customer_reviews.author: Gloucesterman

customer_reviews.title: Great Pepper Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is easy to use. The adjustable grind settings allow for a range of grind from powdered to coarse - and seems to be consistent. It is very easy to refill, the top just pulls off. It also feeds the peppercorns into the grinder very smoothly, I never have to shake it to get the peppercorns to feed in.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a more expensive grinder which broke after maybe 2 years of constant use. This pepper grinder is awesome, far better than any other grinder which I have owned and it seems better built as well. I probably will end up purchasing the matching salt grinder at some point due to how good this one is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable quality. NO fine grind.
customer_reviews.text: Housing made of cheap plastic would be better served by glass construction or higher quality plastic or polycarbonate. Grinding mechanism is smooth but offers nowhere near a fine grind. Effectively a medium to coarse grind only. Acceptable, but no value at $35. Unfortunately, next step up is about $75 and worth it if you require a finer grind
customer_reviews.author: Markas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pepper grinder. There are six settings and I typically will use the fine for cooking and the mid-coarse for my meals. Excellent functionality, however prepare to put some serious, serious pressure on the tiny screw after you fill the peppercorns...
customer_reviews.author: A_Bluez

customer_reviews.title: This came fast and had some rock salt loaded and ready.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when I opened the package and the top popped off. But not to worry, it went on and stayed on. It grinds great. I was frustrated with the plastic salt grinder that comes with pink Himalayan salt from Costco because it stopped grinding. Zero salt. I need salt daily while eating high fat/low carb, so it was a bad failure. This came fast and had some rock salt loaded and ready.
customer_reviews.author: Elector

customer_reviews.title: No fiddling with the little screw at the top of the grinder to tighten up the grinding mechanism to ensure a fine enough grind and then loosening to try to find ...
customer_reviews.text: Grinder is definitely above average in its ability to regulate the coarseness grind. No fiddling with the little screw at the top of the grinder to tighten up the grinding mechanism to ensure a fine enough grind and then loosening to try to find the correct coarseness. though a little expensive if it last, it is worth the price. Also bought the salt grinder. It has ceramic blades so it will not rust with time and is great for grinding the coarse salt. Do not buy the pepper shaker for salt.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the mill. It's adjustments don't slip and the grinding blades are very sharp making it almost effortless. It fits well in my hands and the stainless finish matches our kitchen and looks great. The clear body makes it easy to see when you need to replenish. Very good looking, and utilitarian, kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.author: Katkillr

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't run out of battery power
customer_reviews.text: Nope it doesn't use batteries. I tried that type but I was feeding it batteries so often and still I loved it cause I was lazy about grinding salt. But since I got this I am conformed. I love the adjustment and it doesn't have to be fed batteries.
customer_reviews.author: cool in Rocklin

customer_reviews.title: Best so far
customer_reviews.text: The Cole and Mason salt grinder is by far the best salt grinder I have yet purchased over the years. I owned sever more expensive grinders that did not hold up to the salt build up. This grinder seems like a dream. It is easy to refill and use. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, for a while...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years, the grinder isn't working that well at all. It doesn't dispense much pepper which is what it's made for! Almost like the grinder mechanism is clogged or dulled. I disassembled it to see what the problem was, but couldn't find a reason - dissapointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hannan

customer_reviews.title: Great Pepper Grinder
customer_reviews.text: this thing works great, easy to adjust the grind from rough to fine. One thing I really like is that when you are done grinding you make one extra small turn and when you set the grinder down it doesn't leave a bunch of pepper on the counter. The copper color is nice too. I am buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: redsoccerman

customer_reviews.title: Top isn’t stainless
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. Difficult to change grain size of pepper. Wasn’t expecting the top to be plastic, but that explains the fairly low price. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Average Salt and Pepper Mills
customer_reviews.text: Average Salt and Pepper Mills, they do a decent job of grinding. My complaint is that printing on the bottom ring of the unit that allows you to change to grind from fine to course wore off quickly, so even though you can still change the grind, you don't know which way to turn it, and have to try several settings to see which way you want to turn it. The scale was printed on the adjustment ring, but should have been etched. Other than than they work fine, just a little inconvenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tjaltz316

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pepper Mill
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pepper mill as a xmas gift for my husband. We've purchased other pepper mills in the past, but they didn't hold up for that long. I actually saw this in a store and tested it out. I was VERY impressed! I ordered it on Amazon and I have to tell you that my husband LOVES this pepper mill! There are a few settings for the "grind" of the peppercorns which is excellent. You can set it to fine, medium, etc. I highly recommend this mill. You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Grant

customer_reviews.title: I love this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder. This was my second purchase. This time for grinding salt. There are so many flimsy grinders out there. This one is a bit pricier but it's professional grade. It allows you to adjust the grind size, it's easy to refill, and it provides a consistent grind. Since I use it several times a day it's a pleasure to have something so well made. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NES

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was battery operated. Head slap. It's a nice mill. Gives you good choices about what ground you want. But you gotta turn it. No reason not to get this if you don't mind a little cranking! Top quality. My bad. I cannot read, it seems! lol
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Great blend of affordability and adjustibility.
customer_reviews.text: This strikes me as the perfect upgrade from the low end pepper mills from a department store, without wanting to spend a huge amount on a decorative wooden mill that’s more of a table decoration. This is a quality mill with a clean look and designed to function easily.
customer_reviews.author: Plainshow

customer_reviews.title: The only pepper grinder I’ve ever liked ...
customer_reviews.text: The best thing is the ease of changing the size of the grind. Very precise gradations and I can’t say enough about how superior this is to other grinders I’ve had over the years. No guessing! I may leave this to someone in my will ...
customer_reviews.author: C. Myres

customer_reviews.title: Works well but leaves a mess
customer_reviews.text: I love the pepper grinder that matches this, but this salt grinder is just so-so. It grinds the pink Himalayan sea salt I prefer to use just fine, but unlike with the pepper grinder, a lot of salt residue ends up wherever you set the grinder after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Adele in CBus

customer_reviews.title: Best pepper mill we've ever used.  By far.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a year or two. I can't think of anything I don't like about it. Even my husband praised it and that almost never happens. An easy twist adjusts the grind, which is reliable and consistent. Incredibly easy to fill. Feels nice in hand. For years, we'd been fighting with a succession of cheap pepper mills until I read about this one and decided to spring for it. It is so worth the money. Do yourself a favor. Nice gift for someone who likes to cook.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Grinder settings stop working
customer_reviews.text: After the trial peppercorn that came with the grinder was used, I replaced them with kirkland's telicherry peppercorns and now the settings don't seem to matter. Previously when set on 1, I used to get a nice powder. Right now 1,2 and 3 seem to be the same medium coarseness. This seems to be a problem with the grinder since both peppercorns are the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: I love to grind salt as I cook
customer_reviews.text: I love to grind salt as I cook. However, I thought this would be like its partner, the pepper grinder, and have settings that allow me to choose the size of the grind. Not. I also had to read how to refill it...not in the accompanying info but by a review or question/answer where a family member fixed it for his kids.
customer_reviews.author: Read2Enjoy

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is very easy to fill up and also works great. It grinds very well and it is possible to adjust how it grinds, from small to large pieces. It is possible to get a lot of pepper out of the grinder without a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I discovered that my previous salt grinder's had lost its ability to crush the very coarse salt crystals. I bought this particular model due to CI/ATK's recommendation for the pepper mill. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Little Red

customer_reviews.title: Best grinders I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both cook and this is about the 10th set of grinders we have purchased. They are by far the best. Easy to adjust grind and even easier to fill. We love them. They cost a little more, but less than we have spent on the last 3 sets. I guess you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: Vin. A

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Tasty fresh ground pepper, yum!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace our other fresh pepper hand mill. I was looking for something that was economical, high quality, and easy to use. This grinder matched our stuff perfectly and it is easy to use. It was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this first
customer_reviews.text: I went through several salt grinders that either stopped grinding or the adjusting mechanism didn't work. This grinder is truly adjustable through a large range. It was expensive, but at least it works! Don't know yet about how it will hold up, but it is doing fine after one month.
customer_reviews.author: Al haqiqa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pepper grinder. I am older, and my hand strength is not what it used to be. This makes grinding the pepper really easy. Adjusting the flake size is a little difficult but manageable. I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Willow Ware

customer_reviews.title: Took two tries, but replacement grinder is great!
customer_reviews.text: As another poster experienced, the first mill I bought delivered inconsistent sizes of pepper pieces at the fine setting--about half was indeed very fine, the rest of the pieces were larger and variably sized. Bought a replacement and it's much better at all grind settings. The fine grind is truly fine, and pieces are of consistent size. The grinder has a smooth action and grinds much faster than my 10-year old Peugeot.
customer_reviews.author: Janears

customer_reviews.title: Best pepper grinder I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I can't claim this is the world's best grinder, but it is by far the best I have ever used and I couldn't imagine how any grinder could be better than this. Super smooth mechanism....like a Swiss watch. :)
customer_reviews.author: pdx

customer_reviews.title: Great Mill
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice mill - we've just had it a few days, so we don't know how long it will last, but it is, far and away, the smoothest and easiest mill for pepper grinding - regardless of pepper coarsity chosen.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing on multiple levels...packaging, damage, finish
customer_reviews.text: If this was already damaged before it was shipped that is not OK - if it was damaged in shipping due to the poor packaging, that is also not OK. Additional note - I bought the pepper companion and the finish overall on that item was much higher quality than the salt grinder. The finishes also did not match - but that I understand can happen.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: COLE & MASON Derwent Pepper Grinder - Copper Mill
customer_reviews.text: I gave the pepper grinder to my brother-in-law for Christmas and he really likes it so I bought one for myself. I too really like it. Easy to use. Love that you can get different degree of courseness depending on what recipe you're using it with.
customer_reviews.author: Catnip

customer_reviews.title: Functional And Attractive
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this pepper grinder on an ATK product review. I am pleased with the product. It’s attractive and more functional than others that I have tried, I later purchased the matching salt grinder and tray. They are a permanent fixture on my kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: floridagirl

customer_reviews.title: From the finest grind to the coarsest, mine works exactly like the photos show.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a grinder with a mechanism that produces very consistent results. This grinder will not disappoint. The whole grinder is well made and feel great in the hand. It is also the simplest to fill of any grinder that I’ve ever used. I think it is a terrific value at $35.
customer_reviews.author: Rickie D

customer_reviews.title: Terrible workmanship. Hard to reassemble.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Cheaply made. Markings wore off very quickly. I had issues filling the salt shaker with salt and assembling it back together. The mechanism is very low quality. This is a poorly made product and not worth the money. I’d return the product if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After one refill the grinding mechanism stopped working. For the money I expected much better. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND this product to anyone!!!!! This product did not live up to its reputation!!
customer_reviews.author: Leesa/James

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and looks good!
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use, and size adjustments for this. When done grinding, just give the grinder a slight tap on top, to avoid any carryover onto the surface you are sitting it. It seems like a high quality build that will last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony E Butera

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We have gone through a lot of pepper grinders over the years. They all seem to malfunction at some point and are hard to fill. This one seems to be doing a good job so far!
customer_reviews.author: vicki b

customer_reviews.title: They come filled with salt and pepper which is a nice touch. While the grinders look the same there ...
customer_reviews.text: Based on a review/recommendation on Cooks County TV show I purchased the Salt and the Pepper grinders plus the base as individual items. The cost was approximately $10 or so less than if I purchased them as a set. The grinders are well built and provide grinds the indicated size. They come filled with salt and pepper which is a nice touch. While the grinders look the same there is a slight difference in them as the pepper grinder has 6 size settings and the salt has 3. The only negative I found with them is that the salt grinder is VERY sensitive to the turn. The slightest turn produces, for me, enough salt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
